alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Orleans; Plaquemines (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 11:39AM CDT until May 27 at 9:40PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Jefferson, Orleans, Plaquemines and St. Bernard. * WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1138 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Orleans, Marrero, Harvey, Timberlane, Metairie, Avondale, Belle Chasse, Chalmette, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Bridge City, Terrytown, Woodmere, Elmwood, Estelle, Arabi, River Ridge and Waggaman. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
